poem:
### Wings of Icarus

Shares plummet like clipped wings;
Airbus, bound to earth's shadow,
chasing stars with broken dreams.
Cold metal cries out in shortage—
profits dwindling, hope grounded.
No celestial ascent 
only the quiet sorrow 
of fallen ambition and tarnished gold.
